title: Does art have more an impact on a society? Or conversely, does a society have more an impact on its art? - Quora

A  the Altamira Cave was the original cave where prehistoric paintings were found. Paintings were of such a high quality that scientific society had doubts about their authenticity and accused its discoverer of forgery. (36,500 BCE)  Bhimbetka, central India, contains more than 600 rock shelters adorned with prehistoric cave paintings. The paintings generally depict the times and lives of those living in the caves. ( Mixed influence of society as well other associated phenomena, 13,000 BCE).  23000 BC,Brazil, Serra da Capivara National Park houses a number of rock shelters which are adorned with cave paintings. These paintings include sceneries of hunting and rituals, animal capivaras, and trees. Some researchers think the oldest cave paintings inside the park were created 25,000 years ago. I think that society affects artists on many levels, but the most honorable example would be artists who react on rebel against societies norms. This reaction is usually based upon negative aspects of society: racism, violence, uneven distribution of wealth, sexism and the prevailing political climate. It would be wonderful if Artists influenced society, but we are observers. Of course there are artists who are involved in community art projects and these angels truly have an impact on one select population, and by their successes they might influence others to do the same. Society as a whole, not yet.
